data.event: Washington County was originally formed on January 18, 1838 as Slaughter County in honor of William B. Slaughter, the secretary of Wisconsin Territory.

event.title: A short time later it was renamed

data.event: A short time later it was renamed Washington County, in honor of George Washington.
The first settlers arrived in Washington County in 1835.
The homesteads did not start until 1836.
In 1839, Washington became the final location of the seat of justice.
The first religious society organized by Reverend J.L. Kirkpatrick, a Methodist reverend was created in 1839.
The first newspaper was established in 1853; lasting only two years before crumbling.

event.title: next year another newspaper was created

data.event: The very next year another newspaper was created, which is still viable today.
Soon after the year 1855, a bank was started in the city of Washington and other institutions followed soon after.
No major increase in population happened until the year 1858 when the Mississippi and Missouri Railroad was finished through Washington.
